intro: Raphanus erucoides, commonly known as wild radish, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and broccoli. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers and a hairy, branched stem. Its leaves are lobed and often have a strong, peppery aroma. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
